Google Integration Guide

Many people have a large set of address book data stored in Google Contacts, usually under the hood of GMail itself. If you fall in this category, and you want to copy over that data as a starting point for your ppl address book, you have a few options thanks to the enterprising work of some generous ppl users.

gv-contacts

Part of an npm package called gv, the gv contacts command is a way of importing contacts directly from your Google account into ppl. It imports contacts’ names, phone numbers and email addresses.

goog2ppl

goog2ppl is a python script for converting a contacts.vcf file exported from Google and breaking it up into pieces suitable for initialization as the contents of a ppl address book directory.
